main event: A bright object, described as looking like a bright star, was observed moving slowly and varying in speed, traveling in a northeast direction in Birdsboro, Pennsylvania on June 30, 1965.
interesting points: The object was observed from 2220 hours EDST until 2252 hours local time.
The object was seen south of Birdsboro, Pennsylvania, heading northeast.
The object traveled slowly, with its speed varying, and it 'hooted' to the right and left.
The sighting was reported to the local command post, which then relayed the information to higher headquarters.
The report states that the object was still visible at 2252 local time.
sighted object: a bright object, described as looking like a bright star
